Still worth a play (although it has been mostly superseded by Black Mesa); only drawback that I've noticed compared to HL: Source is that guards and scientists seem to stop following you more often in this release (only truly noticeable in Office Complex).
I've played all the half life 2 games, completed HL2, Ep1, Ep2, Lost Coast, Opposing Force, Still playing HL: Alyx and yet I still haven't completed this game.

No se me ocurre decir algo que no se haya dicho antes sobre este juego. Es una obra maestra, adelantado a su tiempo y muy revisitable por sus incontables mods y demás contenido de la comunidad.
Este juego es de las mejores joyas creadas por Valve, muy recomendado.

Me arrepiento enormemente haberlo abandonado a medias durante dos años. Por ese motivo lo volví a empezar.

Fue uno de los primeros juegos que compré para Steam y no me cabe duda de que es otro de los mejores FPS clásicos de la historia. Es desafiante aunque no frustrante y el elemento de la exploración siempre estará presente si queremos avanzar, resolviendo algunos puzles para solucionar varios de los embrollos en los que nos veremos involucrados. Y sin inundarte de textos ni cinemáticas ya te haces a la idea de lo que sucede. 

A día de hoy sus gráficas no son las mejores pero igual te las gozas. Se juega bastante bien a mi gusto.
No dudaré en jugar su secuela ni de hacerme con los demás juegos de la colección.

¡¡Recomendado!!

El mejor de todos los tiempos

Really good game. I never really played a lot of story FPS titles but this was a pretty sweet experience. I look forward to playing more titles from this series in the future, especially seeing how (I imagine rightfully) beloved it is. The gameplay is quick-paced and keeps you on your toes a lot of the time (hallways collapsing, enemies spawning right in front of you to try and shoot you down) and incorporates another thing I really like in video games: parkour (and also didn't make it hell ;w;). If you like fighting human soldiers, aliens AND zombies, guess what? This game has all of those out to get you. Not only that, but the friendly NPCs make the levels feel a lot less lonely, and help you out when you're in a pinch. In terms of sound design, most if not all sound clips in this game convey something clearly -- explosions sound like explosions, a scientist screaming means there must be some kind of level hazard or enemy ahead, etc. Visual design is also, while mutually outdated, pretty damn good for a game that came out only a year after Sonic R. The people look like people, and the aliens look like aliens. Soldiers look like soldiers, and aren't easily confused with Black Mesa's guards. All in all, I give it a solid 10/10 especially because the manual save system can make up for so much pain.
A masterpiece of epic proportions, the "Saving Private Ryan" of first-person shooters.

I may be 23 years late on this one, but my god is this game incredible. One of the only games to combine cognitive thinking with good shooting mechanics and a stupendous story which continues on into continuations of the series. Every possible element of this game exceeds all expectations for something pre-2000s It's not required that you play this before Half-Life 2, and I'm not sure how far I would go to recommend doing so. In all likelihood you have spoiled yourself to the general story of Half-Life, but that does not stop any of the games from being incredibly fun, especially for their price tag.

Half-Life é um FPS clássico da Valve! O jogo tem uma história incrível e uma gameplay satisfatória. Porém, pelo fato de ser um jogo de 1998 ele é bem bugado. Tirando isso, é um ótimo jogo.
Recomendo.

You are a 35-years-old theoretical physicist who struggling in a huge laboratory, the g-man is pressing you to work day and night. Suddenly ,you got cascaded! Without gravity, you have to kill Nihilanth (15000 teleports /fight) and destroy 2 crystals! How can you do that? Come on ! Gather ammo and save your science team!

TL;DR - Overall, I like this game. I really, really, really hate most of it, but I do recommend it. I think absolutely EVERYONE should play this game at some point in their "gaming career."

I want to start by saying that I'm sorry. I'm sorry that after 10 hours of slogging my way through this game, although I DO recommend it, I can't say I enjoyed myself.

Most of my issues with the game stem from the fact that it feels like Gordon is TRYING to get himself killed. What's that? You fell 10 feet? That's 15 health, down the drain. Did you step in a puddle of radioactive goop that you couldn't avoid, no matter how hard you tried? Sorry, that's 10 health that you've just lost. There are far too many instances where it feels like you're forced to take damage, and it only makes the experience more frustrating as a result. There's slippery terrain, radioactive puddles, lightning shooting out of the walls, pipes spewing hot gas at you, and giant green claw-things that are a nightmare to get around. For how strange and slippery Gordon's movement is, there sure are a LOT of instances of movement being needed to progress. Jumping segments, walking across tight pathways that are way too easy to fall off of, trying to jump across a gap but falling into it instead, falling into water and other dangerous liquids, etc.

Controls aside, I didn't enjoy the combat that much either. Shooting the enemies, namely the soldiers, feels actually pretty great, but they'll almost always gun you down before you can even fire off ten bullets, unless you're willing to sacrifice a third of your health while you shoot them. The headcrabs are hard to hit, the snipers and sheltered turret-soldiers CANNOT be killed unless you have explosives, the tanks vary from imposing to laughable, the minefield segments make me want to break my hand, and overall there are just so many instances of having to save preemptively, before proceeding to die 20 times before taking out every enemy and saving again not even a minute later.

However, although I did not enjoy most of this game, I do think it is great for what Valve had at the time. The most fun I had with the game was listening to the goofy voice acting and watching the unique animations for particular points in the game. I have heard about Half Life for so, so long now, and I can say that I am glad to have played it, not only to see what the hype was about, but also to add it to my library of "gaming knowledge."

--------------------------------------------------------------
====RATING: 8/10. "Ignore the bullshit and you'll be fine."
--------------------------------------------------------------
